This is why I say ,\ndo NOT measure happiness by how many chilled Coke cans you popped.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Turiya is regarded as\nsynonymous with videhamukti, liberation without a body .&nbsp;&nbsp; A saint is a very ordinary guy.. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A sage is the\nextraordinary being. A sage does not dream, because he has no polarity. He\u2019s\njust a witness. His third eye is open.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the four states\nof consciousness, as per Patanjali Yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the waking state\nor jagrat. Beta brain wave<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the dreaming\nstate or svapna.&nbsp; REM sleep state<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the deep sleep\nstate or sushupti. (dream-less deep sleep state , the delta brain wave)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om is the\ntranscendental state or turiya. (beyond all the states) , the fourth has been\ncalled nirvana.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern science has\nlifted their brainwave theories from ancient 7000 year old Hindus scriptures\nand patented it in their names \u2013and they are quite thick skinned about the\nwhole thing\u2014 almost like AL FUCKIN\u2019 GORE.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four stages:\nconsciousness plus thinking is waking, consciousness minus thinking is turiya,\nunconsciousness plus thinking is dreaming, unconsciousness minus thinking is\nsleep.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We ordinary people lack\ncontact with our fourth state of consciousness, and so we fail to live up to\nour potential as human beings.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Turiya yoga emphasizes a complete freedom,\nrejecting force and power, and instead embracing the ideal of a universal\nharmony.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Jivanmukta is a sage\nwho is liberated from bondage even while living with a body.&nbsp; . He has delight in the Self, he sports in\nthe Self, he has company with the Self, he has bliss in the Self.&nbsp; He is autonomous. He has unlimited freedom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Jivanmukta does not\nfeel the necessity for abiding by what brings pleasure to the physical body.\nThe palm of the hand is his bowl, the earth is his bed, the sky is his\nclothing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He has reached the\nclimax of perfection and the whole universe is a part of his body. The forces\nof the universe are his friends, not his enemies .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sage does not care\nfor public criticism. He keeps a cool mind even when he is abused or assaulted.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When God decides to\ngive you moksha it is NOT on mere whims. He keeps a tally. Your Karmic baggage\nrecords an in the Aakasha for him to access. A maharishi who can access\naakashik recors does NOT need to subject you to a written, oral and physical\ntest. &nbsp;&nbsp;He knows who you are. He knows\nwhat you are worth.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We cannot have Mayawati\nsqueaking daily why God showed partiality to Aishwarya Rai. Indeed there is is\na reason why some people are born beautiful and intelligent , and some and born\nugly and stupid. &nbsp;There is a reason why\nsome come first in a race and some come last.&nbsp;\nIt has to do with you karmic baggage.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">YOU WERE BORN WITH THE STARS.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your Karmic baggage accumulated. You have been given FREE WILL .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mind you, &nbsp;every thing which has life has a ball of\nenergy inside it called soul. Only when you become a conscious human does you\nKarmic baggage clock start ticking.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you convert people\nfrom other religions with missionaries aggressively harvesting souls by shoving\nsops down hapless throats, conscience takes a back seat. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the literary\ntraditions of the Upanishads, Brahma Sutras and the Bhagavad Gita, conscience\nis the label given to attributes composing knowledge about virtues and vices\nbut also good and evil, that a soul acquires from the completion of acts and\nconsequent accretion of karma over many lifetimes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE KARMA LAW MAKES\nSURE THAT CRIME AMONG HINDUS BY PERCENTAGE IS THE LOWEST ON THE PLANET.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE WEST POOH POOHS\nKARMA AND RE-BIRTH, YET THEY DO PAST LIFE REGRESSION. SOME STRANGE\nINCONSISTENCY HERE . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any person of honor\nchooses rather to lose his honor than to lose his conscience. Nobel peace prize\nwinners striking and killing unarmed civilians with drones to preserve their\nway of life, talk about \u201cthis years fashion in conscience\u201d in Presidential\ndebates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And they go around with\ntheir work happily , with an audience clapping and cheering them on. What\nirony! Once your conscience, which is the window to your spirit,&nbsp; is offended it shows on your face --as it is\ngood bye tranquil mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such evil people\nmistake short memory for a clear conscience. Conscience is your inner\nantenna.&nbsp; Human dignity requires an\nupright conscience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deep within his\nconscience every man discovers a celestial law which he has not laid upon\nhimself,&nbsp; even society or his upbringing\n-- which he must obey.&nbsp; It is his most\nsecret core, and his sanctuary, where he is alone with God, to have a silent\nand short dialogue . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To youngsters who are\nabout to take up a career , I will tell them this\u2014\u201cNever take up a job in which\nyou cannot apply your own conscience\u201d&nbsp;\nThis is in case you want to happy , when your work is a continuous\nfestival of joy. Then you can have&nbsp; a\nface without lines , like yours truly- at the age of 59.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A comfortable house and\nwealth is a great source of happiness. It ranks only after good health which\nsprings out of happiness anchored by good conscience. A guilty conscience needs\nno accuser. There is pillow as hard as a guilty conscience. Conscience is what\nmakes you behave well behind closed doors or when nobody is looking...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience an aspect of\nextended consciousness beyond survival-related dispositions . Conscience is a\ngift of crisis--- It tells you the right thing to do when you don't have time\nto figure it all out. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience thinks in a\nflash, in terms of metaphor, feelings, pictures, and the spatial whole and\ndoesn't fit neatly into the cause-and-effect model. Your conscience will not\nforce you to do things that are truly wrong for yourself or other people in\ncontradiction with the laws of the universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We cannot command our\nconscience to use it at will. It just surfaces spontaneously when certain\ncircumstances are present\u2014it suddenly appears as a feeling. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscience extrapolates\nlarger truths . Use it as a guide always, never ignore it. If you do NOT have a\nconscience you cannot attain moksha , no matter whether you pray to God -- 5\ntimes a day on your knees or 50.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We all know what the\nIrish Catholics did to Savita , right?&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just because it is\nwritten \u201cNO SWIMMING ON SUNDAYS \u201c\u2014 they will NOT rescue a Hindu child drowning\non Sunday , and ignore the cries for help.&nbsp;\nThese immoral people&nbsp; will happily\nwatch the child drown and be happy about it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/11/savita-halappanavar-murder-of.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/11/savita-halappanavar-murder-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hope their Lord will\ngive them salvation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now let me talk about\nego.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ego thrives on\nothers and lives on attention . Human ego demands personal recognition and\nwastes energy in resentment if it does not get enough. The underlying emotion\nfor the ego is fear, the fear of being a nobody.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chatter of the ego\ncontinuously disrupts the natural state of well being.&nbsp; Stress is from within the mind , not by\nexternal threat.&nbsp; Ego creates suffering\nwithout recognising it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\u2019s hard to get into\nthe boardrooms and MD offices of some organizations because the egos of the\nleaders take up way too much space. Only bootlickers and hand kissers are\nallowed into their inner sanctum. They recruit yes-men instead of capable men.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The waitress turned\nempress has surrounded herself with a desh drohi coterie. Ego tries to enlarge\nand strengthen by forming gangs and posses. Here the ego has simply shifted\nfrom the personal to the collective.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their ego makes them\ntake everything personally. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They mistake a short\nmemory for a clear conscience and are miserabe within.&nbsp; They are unable to listen to another person's\nview without feeling threatened. They leave debris and destruction wherever\nthey go. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are very eager to\nsee their picture in newspapers.&nbsp; &nbsp;During the Kedarnath Floods the Catholic Italian\nQueen Bee \u201cflagged off &nbsp;trucks\u201d in great\nstyle ,(&nbsp; like how Nero flagged off the\ngames in Rome) --&nbsp; with relief supplies where\nthere was a huge tragedy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting personal\nmileage out of gruesome human tragedy\u2014Hindus cannot dream of doing this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every aid packet had\nthe picture of the waitress and her AKKAL KA DUSHMAN son .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their indifference\narises due to ego. Their ego cannot distinguish between a situation and their\ninterpretation and reaction to that situation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Cooperation is alien to ego\nexcept when there is a secondary motive. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">The EGO concept is inherent in Sanatana Dharma , you are cremated unless you have NIL ego.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ego becomes the\ngrit in the system that gets in the way of authentic meaningful communication.\nTheir self-talk is the mouthpiece of ego, their inflated, overbearing egos\ncreate rules for rules\u2019 sake.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They complicate\nprocedures , squash good ideas and keep good people down. Their ego makes them\nunwilling to admit that they know zilch about a subject in a meeting\u2014the\nequivalent of the ear trying to tell what it saw and tasted and smelt, in a\nbulldozing manner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They brood endlessly on\ntheir petty grievances, never held before them any vision that might have\nlifted them out of themselves. They substitute their thinking capabilities with\ntheir loud cynical talking capabilities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Have you ever heard the\nQueen Bee\u2019s immoral spokesmen on TV , calling Modi &nbsp;who tried to help at Kedarnath, as Rambo ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Compulsive liars are\ndriven by egos feelings of insufficiency.. Ego will force them to make life\ndifficult for others\u2014for they feel the need to put people in their place or get\ninto one-upmanship games. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such wretched people\nwould give only conditional love to a small child or a kitten. They would flag\noff the food to a starving kitten,&nbsp; with\nTV cameras running.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ego confuses opinions\nwith facts . Every ego is a master of selective perception and distorted\ninterpretation. Ego likes to judge and be right. To the ego the present moment\nNOW hardly exists and is always concerned with keeping the past alive. Ego\nlooks at the present with jaundiced eyes of the past.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When people argue they\nwill act as if they are fighting for survival and there is a imminent need to\nwin at all costs. Such is the self delusion caused by ego. The ego thrives on\nreactivity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To be free of ego all\nyou need to do is to be aware of your thoughts and emotions as they happen.\nAwareness and ego cannot coexist. It is difficult to see one's own ego. There\nis a fine line between pride and arrogance, that line is called EGO.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The danger zone is when\nyou start thinking that your accomplishments earn you the right to be\ncondescending, obnoxious and abusive. Since leadership is of spirit, the ego\npowered men can never be good leaders--they can never rise over the post of a\nmangy manager.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the nature of the\nright brain lobe, to be accepting and free of judgements. Ego makes a donkey\nthink that he is THE champion race horse.\u2014 or an ex-waitress to think that she\nis an empress of the first King on Earth\u2019s lineage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jealousy has the power\nto destroy.&nbsp; There is no greater\npunishment than the primal emotion of jealousy,&nbsp;\nfor it is the most potent cause of unhappiness.&nbsp; Jealousy causes negative feelings and misery\nwhich corrode your innards like rust to iron. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you get jealous\nyou drink poison and wait for the other person to die-&nbsp; TEE HEEEE!.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IS THERE A WESTERN\nMEDICINE FOR NEGATIVITY, JEALOUSY, GREED , HATE etc. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THERE IS ONLY ONE MEDICINE , SPIRITUALITY.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RIGHT NOW IT EXISTS\nONLY IN INDIA AND BALI . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you are jealous\nyou count the other fellow's blessings instead of your own, and lose your peace\nof mind\u2014rather burn up inside.. It is in the character of very few men to honor\nwithout envy a friend who has prospered. The sure mark of one born with noble\nqualities, is being born without envy.&nbsp;\nOf the seven deadly sins, only envy aint no fun at all.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The surest route to\nbreeding jealousy is to compare In Hinduism, envy is a disastrous emotion.&nbsp; Hinduism maintains that anything which causes\nthe mind to lose balance with itself , leads to misery.&nbsp; Envy cannot coexist with truth and spiritual\nwisdom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"One who does not envy\nbut is a compassionate friend to all ... such a devotee is very dear to Me\" -\n<b>Lord Krishna in Bhagavad Gita</b>, Chapter 12, Verse 15. 4000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting back-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moksha is not an\nachievement, therefore there is no competition.&nbsp;\nIt is liberation from , the cycle of death and rebirth.&nbsp; Your soul achieves its pure self.&nbsp; After liberation or nirvana or moksha there\nis no rebirth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are no marks and\ngrading. You get Moksha or you don\u2019t, depending on what you are worth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After you get Moksha\nthere are no re-births.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These are NO unreliable\nconcepts . Nothing written by ancient maharishis were ever proved wrong. &nbsp;This is why the jealous white invader &nbsp;injected poison and took away the\noriginals.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we brown skinned\nIndian slaves are savages\u2014why has the master race white man learnt our\nlanguages. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why did they thrust English down our throats. &nbsp;&nbsp;Do they think we cannot send a rocket to Mars\nin any of our state languages , which existed thousands of years before English.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can a white kid beat an\nIndian kid in the SPELLING BEE \u2013 &nbsp;conducted in the stupid English language ?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We\ndo NOT have STUPID spellings or syntax &nbsp;in\nIndian languages .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The attainment of\nmoksha is EXTREMELY rare and countless reincarnations are required for a person\nto reach this state of spiritual perfection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hlndu Dharma tells\nthat&nbsp; man does not live by bread alone,\nnor by his work, bank balance, slimy popularity , ambition or power or relations\nto external nature. He lives or must live by his life of&nbsp; spirit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moksha is\nself-emancipation. The fulfillment of the spirit in us in the heart of the\neternal. This is what gives ultimate satisfaction and all other activities are\ndirected to the realization of this end.&nbsp;\nIt is attained by realization of our true identity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads\nestablished moksha as the ultimate goal of all Hindu religious and spiritual\nactivity. Moksha is the fulfillment of life's purpose. Life ends on this earth\nplane when you attain Moksha or liberation from birth and death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You are liberated from\nlittleness into vastness, from bondage to boundless bliss. . The conquest of\nignorance, ego, attachment, and impulse brings about liberation (moksha) for\nthe individual. The one who is a slave to impulses and tendencies (vasanas) is\ndevoid of wisdom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without jnana, there\ncan be no moksha.&nbsp; Jnana is always\nrevealed in spontaneous utterances.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the sensual\ndesires are blowing strong, the&nbsp;\njnana-lamp cannot burn. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You cannot get jnana by\nshaking your&nbsp; ass &nbsp;in a discotheque and watching sugar daddy\u2019s\nSunny Leone in blue movies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga destroys destroys\nall impulses and urges towards the sensual world. Yoga and jnana are like oil\nand flame. The oil is yoga and jnana is the illumining flame of the lamp.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even\nif at the last moment of his life one is able to realize this&nbsp; jnana , he is certain to be liberated from\nthe cycle of birth and death.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why almost all\natheists cry out to god just before they die. This is the time hypocrisy goes\nfor a toss. &nbsp;&nbsp;Moksha does NOT make your\nsoul extinct.&nbsp; It just means that it is\nthe final end of anymore earthly sojourns for your soul and you have merged\nwith the mother energy field of brahmAn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moksha means liberation\nafter death.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Jivanmukt is a LIVING\nliberated soul.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Liberation, while living,\nis called Jivanmukti and those who have attained it are called Jivanmuktas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jivanmukta&nbsp; is one who is devoid of likes/dislikes,\nsorrow/elation and whose intellect is divine.\u201d-Mahopanishad (2/57)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A jIvanmukta is one who\ndoes not see anything separate from the Self.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThe Realized Man has transcended all destiny and is bound neither by the\nbody nor by its destiny. His actions are cosmic movements and not the instincts\nof the sense of egoism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He had unbound\ncompassion for anything living. The outside world could not produce any change\nin his Self, as the rivers flowing into the ocean cannot disturb its\nimmeasurable and bottomless waters. The great ethical virtues, such as\nhumility, unselfishness, purity, kindness, kinship, lack of ego and greed&nbsp; all adorned him like shining jewels.&nbsp; He did not actively seek them- they clung to\nhim.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe Jivanmukta is he\nwho does not frighten the world nor is he afraid of the world; he is free from\njoy, anger and fear as well\u201d - Laghu Yoga Vasishtam. 5.95<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like I said before ,\ndeath occurs to the physical body only and not to the Atman ( soul ).&nbsp; The scriptures tell us&nbsp; that the energy body of Atman is \u2018na jAyate\u2019\n(never born), \u2018na mriyate\u2019 (never dies).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You are your SOUL.&nbsp; YOU have never belonged to your current\ncadaver. It is a temporary&nbsp; resting\nplace. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN WE DO NAMASTE , WE\nBOW TO THE BALL OF ENERGY ( SOUL ) INSIDE THE OTHER MAN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A jivan mukta does not\nget delighted by pleasures. He has got nothing to obtain or avoid.&nbsp; He does NOT feel&nbsp; helpless or dejected.&nbsp; He does NOT expect any publicity , reward or\nreturn . . Whatever he does is righteous, moral and ideal.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He has no tussle\nbetween the body and the spirit.&nbsp; His\nexternal actions are just like those of the ignorant worldly man.&nbsp; But the greatest difference lies between\ntheir minds, the desires and Vasanas.&nbsp;\nThe one does not know what is desire and the other is immersed in\ndesires.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the liberated sage\nthere is no delusion for he sees oneness everywhere. He is not affected by\neither what he has done or what he has not done. But he knows his prabdhas. He\nis free from all the modifications of the mind. His heart is pure like the\nHimalayan snow crystal. . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An ordinary mortal(\nlike you and me)&nbsp; cannot love and serve\nthose who hate him,&nbsp; who beat him and who\nabuse him always. The liberated sage, the prince of ascetics&nbsp; has transcendental love. He does not exert to\nacquire any object that is limited in space and time. He knows that all things\nof great value are free.&nbsp; His&nbsp; sense of want has been&nbsp; annihilated once and for all by the ineffable\nexperience of Self-realization.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you fail to see God\nin the present life, then after death you must take on another body; if you see\nGod, then you will break free from the cycle of birth and death. God can be\nseen, like the reflection in a mirror, in a pure heart.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the senses are\ncalm and the mind is motionless, then your heart is pure; you have reached the\nhighest state of consciousness, in which you are unified with God. If this\nstate of consciousness is firm and secure, so it can never be bro ken, then you\nare free.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No one can find out\nwhether a Jivanmukta is a learned one or is ignorant, whether he is virtuous or\nvicious. . When all the desires&nbsp; and\nknots that are lodged in the heart are cast off, then the mortal becomes Jivan\nMukta. Such people are the veritable Emperors of the universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 7 Seven stages\nof Jivanmukta--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the first stage one\ndesires to know Brahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the second, he\nstarts enquiry .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the third he knows\nBrahman indirectly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These three are\nconsidered to be in the waking state of Jivanmukta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the fourth stage, he\nrealizes Brahman directly and the world appears to him as a dream. In this state\nhe is called Brahmavit, and this state is considered to be like dream state.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gradually the\nJivanmukta enters into the fifth stage where he is absorbed in\nNirvikalpasamadhi. In this state he is called Brahmavidvara. Now and then he\ncomes out of the Samadhi either out of his own will or on request.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is like\nthe stage like Sushupti where he is awake while asleep and asleep while awake,\nand is called a Brahmavidvariyan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The next is the final\nstage where he internally renounces all actions and does not desire anything\nfor himself. His inner eye is open, even though he may perceive all things with\nhis external eyes and perform all normal activities.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This stage is called\nTuriya State in which he is known as Brahmavidvarishtha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He comes out of this\nstage of his own will to grace the world. He is full of bliss and happiness,\nand therefore appears to be an ordinary man; but in reality, he is free from\nall delusions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person who has\nprogressively attained these higher stages of consciousness, works for\nsalvation of the entire creation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike other world\nreligions that teach that the path to salvation is narrow, Hinduism allows for\na multiplicity of ways to attain moksha depending on the personalities, tastes,\nand temperaments of its different devotees.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In general, four\ndifferent spiritual paths are widely accepted in Hinduism. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are the ways of\nselfless work (Karma Yoga), of self-dissolving love (Bhakti Yoga), of absolute\ndiscernment (Jnana Yoga), and of raised Kundalini meditative immersion (Raja\nYoga). The paths are not generally seen as mutually exclusive but\ncomplimentary.:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma marga allows an\nethical person who uses his conscience and integrity , to remain within society\ninstead of becoming a renunciation, while also cultivating qualities important\nin the achievement of salvation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this path, one acts for the good of society\nwhile pursuing spiritual progress and adhering to standards of correct action.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma Yoga is the path\nof 'action', of putting in 100 percent effort, without being attached to the\noutcome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThy right is to work\nonly, but never with its fruits; let not the fruits of action be thy motive,\nnor let thy attachment be to inaction. As the ignorant men act from attachment\nto action, so should the wise act without attachment, wishing the welfare of\nthe world\u201d - The <b>Bhagavad Gita 4000 BC<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma yoga can be\napplied to everything you do: from from the most trivial, ordinary tasks to\ngreater, more challenging works. When action is performed selflessly, with full\nfocus and attention, it brings fulfillment and freedom.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acting without being\nattached to the fruits of one's deeds \u2013 this alone can lead to union with the\nSelf, which is the goal of yoga....<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma is a crucial\nHindu concept. According to the doctrine of karma, our present condition in\nlife is the consequence of the actions of our previous lives.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The choices we\nhave made in the past directly affect our condition in this life, and the\nchoices we make today and thereafter will have consequences for our future\nlives in samsara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jnana marga is known as\nthe path of wisdom, and places much emphasis on study and pursuit of knowledge.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This includes the study of philosophy that\naddress spirituality and the laws of the universe. In this path,\nself-realization (Atma siddhi/ Atmavidya) is the key to obtaining moksha.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And\nthe core of this knowledge is '<b>Tat tvam asi'.</b> 'you are indeed the Self' .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Watch your\nthoughts, they become words.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Watch your words, they\nbecome actions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Watch your actions,\nthey become habits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Watch your habits, they\nbecome your character.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Watch your character,\nit becomes your destiny.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To stuff one's mouth\nwith food is not the same as eating. One should attain a state when all organs\nof perception and action work from knowledge. Wisdom (jnana) does not mean\nintellectual acumen or dialectical power. Jnana is realjzed experience.&nbsp; If we have true insight, right action will\ntake care of itself. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Truth and conscience\ncannot but act rightly.&nbsp; The path of\nknowledge is the rnost difficult of the four paths because the capacity to see\neverything in its essence or perception setting aside the gross covering it is\nnot a gift given by god to all human beings.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To attain Jnana, you\nmust have one-pointedness of mind (Ekagrata). Ekagrata comes through Upasana.\nUpasana comes through purity of heart (Chitta Suddhi).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chitta Suddhi comes through Nishkamya Karma\nYoga.&nbsp; To do Nishkamya Karma, you must\nhave controlled the Indriyas. The Indriyas can be controlled through Viveka and\nVairagya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhakti marga, or\ndevotion, is the most common path in Hinduism today. Bhakti involves\ncultivating a very personal connection to the divine through a conduit, found\nin the form of a deity.&nbsp; Bhakti typically\ninvolves intense devotional worship of a chosen deity, and the expression of\nsingle-minded love.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jew Rothschild HIJACKED\nTHE BHAKTI MARGA and gave us FAKE and backdated saints to worship. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modi will soon go to\nLondon to pray to Basava.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let us see to whom he prays more--&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ROTHSCHILD'S GANDHI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ROTHSCHILDs BR AMBEDKAR</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OR</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ROTHSCHILDs BASAVA</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of the most\npopular deities in Hinduism include Shiva, Vishnu, Krishna, Ganesha, Kali or\nBhagawati Devi (the Mother Goddess). The way of devotion is the most popular\none. Sinners as well as saints, ignorant as well as learned, dimwits as well as\nwise find it too dang easy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prayer and petition.\nfasting and sacrifice, communion and self-examination, all are included in the\nlife of devotion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Raja yoga ( king of\nyogas ) is Kundalini rise<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whatever path you chose\n, and what efforts you put, only the grace of god (who calls&nbsp; the shots ) can give you&nbsp; moksha \u2014read this twice.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">God can even give you\ndivine exemption and dispensation for balance bad Karma .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karma refers to the\ntotality of our actions and their concomitant reactions in this and previous\nlives, all of which determines our future.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the interplay between our experience and how we respond to it that\nmakes karma devastating or helpfully invigorating.&nbsp; The conquest of karma lies in intelligent\naction and dispassionate reaction.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not all karmas rebound\nimmediately.&nbsp; Some accumulate and return\nunexpectedly in this or other births.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ultimate reward is\nrelease from samsara and union with God.&nbsp;\nSamsara represents the cycle of life, death, and rebirth in which a\nperson carries his or her own karma.&nbsp;\nEach life cycle presents an opportunity for redressal and balance.&nbsp; \u201c You reap what you sow\" mirrors the\nHindu concept of karma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A hundred and one\nlights radiate from the heart. One of them shines upwards to the crown of the\nhead. This Brahma Nadi points the way to immortality. Every other light points\nto death.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many enlightened persons but to find a liberated person\nworthy of moksha is extremely rare.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ninkRTmCegU/VjZveMSzVUI/AAAAAAABBcQ/85DZOoBCASc/s1600/FiYgure-2-Nadis.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ninkRTmCegU/VjZveMSzVUI/AAAAAAABBcQ/85DZOoBCASc/s1600/FiYgure-2-Nadis.png\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c981966624830725105\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_86M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/10/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_10.html?showComment=1446375270095#c1472855984180261427\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">November 1, 2015 at 4:24 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_86MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi mc,<br />\n<br />\nNADI IS A STREAM OF PRANA.<br />\n<br />\nIDA MEANS INTROVERT (MOON-FEMALE )<br />\n<br />\nPINGALA MEANS EXTROVERT ( SUN-MALE )<br />\n<br />\nSORRY CHUTNEY MARY FEMINISTS !<br />\n<br />\nWhen the left nostril ( right brain lobe for right hander ) is PREDOMINANT it is the lunar energy or Ida Nadi which is flowing. When the right nostril ( left brain lobe ) DOMINATES, the solar energy or Pingala Nadi is flowing.<br />\n<br />\nWhen the Kundalini Shakti awakens it passes through Sushumna Nadi.<br />\n<br />\nShakti travels up Sushumna Nadi to become One with her husband Shiva in Sahasrara chakra.<br />\n<br />\nThis is NOT perverted sex..<br />\n<br />\nGanesha ( son ) opens the door ( Mooladhara bandhana at sacrum bone ) for his mother .<br />\n<br />\nWhat do petty minds like Zakir Naik know?<br />\n<br />\nWhen only Ida and Pingala are active without Sushumna, it is like having the positive and negative lines in your electrical cable, without grounding.<br />\n<br />\nEnergy flows through Ida and Pingala all the time, yet its effulgence is very low.<br />\n<br />\n\"Ida\" lies to the left of the spine, whereas \"Pingala\" is to the right side of the spine, mirroring the \"Ida\".<br />\n<br />\nSushumna runs along the spinal cord in the center, through the seven chakras, \"Mooladhara\" at the base, and \"Sahasrara\" at the top (or crown) of the head. It is at the base of this \"Sushumna\" where the \"Kundalini\" lies coiled in three and a half coils, in a dormant or sleeping state.<br />\n<br />\nSushumna Nadi connects the base chakra to the crown chakra.<br />\n<br />\nPingala has a sun like nature and male energy. Its temperature is heating and courses from the left testicle to the right nostril. Id\u0101 has a moonlike nature and female energy with a cooling effect. It courses from the right testicle to the left nostril.<br />\n<br />\nIda Nadi controls all the mental processes while Pingala Nadi controls all the vital processes. At Swadhisthana chakra, or the sacral plexus, the three nadis come together again and Ida and Pingala cross over one another.<br />\n<br />\nIda passes up to the right, Pingala to the left, and Sushumna continues to flow directly upwards in the central canal.<br />\n<br />\nThe three Nadis come together again at Manipura chakra, the solar plexus, and so on. Finally, Ida, Pingala and Sushumna meet in the Ajna chakra.<br />\n<br />\nSushumna Nadi is regarded as a hollow tube, in which there are three INNER concentric tubes, each being progressively more subtle than the previous one.<br />\n<br />\nThe INNER CONCENTRIC tubes / nadis are as follows:<br />\n1. Sushumna- signifying Tamas,<br />\n2. Vajrini \u2013signifying Rajas,<br />\n3. Chitrini signifying Sattva, and<br />\n4. Brahma- signifying consciousness.<br />\n<br />\nThe higher consciousness created by Kundalini passes through Brahma Nadi\u2014OPENED by Ganesha.<br />\n<br />\nOnly when Kundalini Shakti awakens and travels up the Sushumna passage to Sahasrara, does the entire store of higher energy in man begun to be unleashed.<br />\n<br />\nWhen a man with 12 strand DNA ( NIL junk ) and a king sized pineal gland does this, like an ancient Maharishi\u2014he becomes a supercomputer .<br />\n<br />\nHe does NOT need a cockpit in a Vimana.<br />\n<br />\nHe is the cockpit.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just because a fake\nsaint deceived everbody claiming to be a videha , and his followers buried him\nin meditative pose, he will NOT attain moksha. Rather he will pay dearly for\nhis deceit.&nbsp; Emancipation during one's\nlife time is Jivanmukti while the same after death is Videhamukti. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India a known Jivan mukta like Adi Shankaracharya\n, is above the law of the land meant for wordly humans. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
