How stupid can you be !</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/daltons-atomic-theory-sage-kashyapa-and.html</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Varahamihira the great Astrologer and astronomer from wrote 4600 years ago, in the opening of his Samhita, \u201c It has been said in Vedas that the first primeval thing was darkness, which is not identical with the black colour, but a kind of non-existence like the state of a sleeping person.\u201d</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/mihira-muni-great-astrologer-cum.html</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">God has given us 5 senses of narrow bandwidth, so that we do NOT have an information overload breakdown.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The quantum world cannot be observed by our 5 senses, and they do NOT follow the cause and effect laws of classical physics. We live in a time obstructed world using 5 senses -- and also a timeless realm in the quantum dimension, where what you see is NOT what you get.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Without factoring in consciousness there can be NO Theory of Every Thing (TOE) and Grand Unification Theory (GUT). When science meets the consciousness field of Vedanta written 7000 years ago, the last frontier can be breached.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The morphogenetic field or BrahmAn of Vedanta, has a self organizing electro magnetic nature. This is a merged grand Akashik field of several morphic fields of different nature by resonant coupling. This inductive field has consciousness and self initiating nature.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">CONTINUED TO 4-</span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_20B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6796334591065123014\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_20M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_20MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">CONTINUED FROM 3-</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">This non-linear field is holographic and holds information of not only past history by even every thought , emotion and feeling held in the right hand subconscious lobe of your brain. This explains the power of prayer and intention. The whole cosmos is interconnected in this field and speed is NOT restricted to speed of light.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">This field amplifies when a large number of conscious people are involved focused with great intention on a single emotional thought chanting a single acoustic mantra which resonates their DNA. For example, the pilgrims at Sabarimala ( 100 million last year ) and the Kumbh Mela ( 50 million ) amplify this consciousness field.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">At Sabarimala pilgrimage , the whole idea is to see the 3 flashes. The few seconds of time between the second and third flashes is one of PURE AWARENESS , which causes group resonance and quantum entrainment. Prana is amplified and focused like a laser beam.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Quantum Physics like Vedas tell us that particles and waves are the same thing. Your intention determines whether you see a particle or a wave.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/sabarimala-makaravilakku-three-light.html</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">This universe cannot exist without vibrations between two poles. Quantum physics has showed the ancient Indian Yogis were NOT mere dreamers of cosmic consciousness, where our bodies, our brain and its mind, as inextricably joined with other matter and the mega dipole of universe .</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Indian Vedic maharishis had the inherent ability to go on either side of the narrow band of five human senses. They could transcend the senses and limitations of space-time.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">In the quantum picture, electromagnetic radiation has a dual nature, existing both as waves and as streams of particles called photons. Photons are exchanged whenever electrically charged subatomic particles interact.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The photon has no electric charge, so it does not experience the electromagnetic force itself\u2014in other words, photons cannot interact with one another.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">At the level of quantum reality the universe is not made up of things. It is comprised of oscillating fields of energy. In the quantum domain everything is interrelated. The universe is filled with an incomprehensible amount of energy and substance\u2014some of which is imperceptible to our physical senses.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Radio waves, microwaves, infrared waves and microscopic particles are just a few examples of the infinite aspects of reality that elude the perception of our 5 senses.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Narrowing our 5 senses bands , serve as a filter or squelch to prevent breakdown due to excess information. The 5 senses create the set for the stage we call our lives.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">ALL INITIAL QUANTUM PHYCISISTS LEARNT SANSKRIT, AND THE VEDAS . THEY PONDERED ABOUT MAYA BEHIND THE QUANTUM SCREEN. . THEY ARE NOT STUPID TO DO THIS.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The theory of Maya is one of the grand pillars upon which Vedanta rests. The word origin of MAYA is derived from the Sanskrit roots MA ( not ) and YA ( that ). The term MAYA is mentioned 72 times in Rigveda written down in Sanskrit in 5000 BC. Maya is mentioned 29 times in the Atharva Veda.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">In Puranas and Vaishnava theology, Maya is described as one of the nine shaktis of the reclining Vishnu. MAYA is the veritable fabric of duality, and she performs this role at the behest of BrahmAn, the morphogenetic consciousness field.. The Supreme God is not bound by Maya just as magicians do not believe the illusions of their own magic.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Our 5 senses serve as a filter allowing us to experience only what is absolutely necessary for our physical existence. The 5 senses create the set for the stage we call our lives. The senses squelch out , let we will have a breakdown due to excess information. The quantum world cannot be observed by our 5 senses, and they do NOT follow the cause and effect laws of classical physics.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">CONTINUED TO 5--</span></div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_20MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_20BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_20B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_21B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3316054655910645909\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_21MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">CONTINUED FROM 4-</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Maya is invisible and beyond sense-perception. What is the difference between a quantum physicist and an ancient Indian maharishi seer of 9500 BC ?</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The mystics took existence for granted, and knew how to get from here to there. ( breath of Brahma ).. The Puranas speak of the creation and destruction of the universe in cycles of 8.64 billion years, that is quite close to currently accepted value regarding the time of the big bang.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Even today the speed of light calculated by most modern means is same as what was calculated in Surya Siddhantam 6000 years ago.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The seer placed himself inside and saw outwards, for he has the perception afforded by a king sized pineal gland and 12 strand DNA to do so.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The CLASSICAL scientist with a shriveled pineal gland and 2 strand DNA ( 97% junk ) with pre-conceived notions pounded in by a moron Isaac Newton stood outside and peeked inside all the while scratching his head.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">The Bible says that the big bang happened in 4004 BC, while Vedanta and the modern quantum theory agrees that it is around 15 billion years.</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">None of the quantum scientists have categorized Vedanta as a religious work. &nbsp;MOSES PROMISED HIM THAT ..</b></span></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 35.2px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: cambria, serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 37.3333px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 35.2px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: cambria, serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 37.3333px;\">PEOPLE ASK WHY WAS JETHRO SO COMMITTED TO THE LAND OF PALESTINE?&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;BECAUSE HE WAS FROM THE LAND OF PUNT, WHO CREATED JUDAISM AND THE LANGUAGE HEBREW.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 35.2px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 35.2px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: cambria, serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 37.3333px;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">ZIPPORAH WOULD LATER CIRCUMCISE HER SON GERSHOM USING A SHARP FLINT (&nbsp;</span><span style=\"color: red;\">WITH COPPER ELEMENT- SECRETS OF AYURVEDA</span><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp; ) \u2014 THE WAY THE YOUNGER BROTHERS OF KERALA NAMBOODIRIS DID, TO PREVENT INFECTION. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 35.2px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 35.2px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: cambria, serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 37.3333px;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">SHE THREW THE FORESKIN OF HER SONs PENIS , ON THE FEET OF MOSES IN DISGUST FOR BREAKING HIS PROMISE TO HER FATHER JETHRO.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 35.2px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br /><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 35.2px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: cambria, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Jesus Christ is &nbsp;identified as a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek quoting from Ps. 110:4.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Melchizedek is Jesus\u2014NAY\u2014Apollonius of Tyana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">DEAD SEA SCROLLS TELL CLEARLY THAT PAGAN ESSENES WERE UNCIRCUMCISED AND MELCHIZEDEK<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Reference between the messiah and Melchizedek appears in subsequent biblical verses: Genesis 14:18-20; Psalm 110:1-7 Matthew 22:44; 26:26-28 Luke 22:19; Mark 14:22 John 6:53 Acts 2:34 I Corinthians 11:23-25 Hebrews 4:14-15; 5:6; 5:10; 6:19-20; 7:1-21. Revelation 1:6.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Melchizedek is mentioned twice in the Hebrew Bible, the first in Genesis and the second in Psalms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Genesis 14:18 introduces Melchizedek a \"Priest of the Most High God\" (El Elyon), a term which is re-used in 14:19, 20, 22.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The second and final Hebrew Bible mention of Melchizedek is in Psalm 110:4.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The Lord hath sworn, and will not repent: 'Thou art a priest for ever after the manner of Melchizedek.'. (JPS 1917)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">11Q13 (11QMelch) is a fragment (that can be dated to the end of the 2nd or start of the 1st century BC) of a text about Melchizedek found in Cave 11 at Qumran in the Israeli Dead Sea area and which comprises part of the Dead Sea Scrolls.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">&nbsp;In this eschatological text, Melchizedek is seen as a divine being and Hebrew titles such as Elohim are applied to him. According to this text Melchizedek will proclaim the \"Day of Atonement\" and he will atone for the people who are predestined to him. He also will judge the peoples<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The association or identification of Melchizedek with the Messiah predates Christianity, developing in Jewish messianism of the Second Temple period<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">The association or identification of Melchizedek with the Messiah predates Christianity, developing in Jewish messianism of the Second Temple period.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">According to Encyclop\u00e6dia Britannica, Joseph Smith ( MORMON ) &nbsp;\"appointed his male followers to priesthoods, named for the biblical figures Melchizedek and Aaron, that were overseen by the office of High Priest\"</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-kOuSYUNaGWg/W1hyUVavMeI/AAAAAAABdCs/71o_gbhe9nM9tJHhrxjRI02tDBLZoImjgCLcBGAs/s1600/rrMelchiz-Abe.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; &nbsp;In Kerala we call them NASRANIS.. They are pagan Hindus.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: cambria, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">COLLOSSEUM OF ROME WAS BUILT ON A DRIED UP LAKE.. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: cambria, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">DURING FLOODING CAUSED BY HEAVY RAINS , THE INSIDES OF THE COLLOSEUM USED TO LOOK LIKE A LAKE.. THIS DOES NOT MEAN THERE WERE SHIPS INSIDE FIGHTING MOCK BATTLES TO ENTERTAIN PUBLIC..</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; Water is one of the best known solvents .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Liquid water absorbs\nradiation of all wavelengths, except a narrow window in the visible\n(photochemical) waveband. This window is critical for photolysis and directly\nor indirectly influences the development of all life on Earth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water\u2019s high thermal\nconductivity speeds up heat redistribution in living tissues, which helps\nprotect the body from uneven heating and cooling, whether such changes are\ncaused by metabolic processes or external mechanisms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though water freezes at\nzero deg C , however if it is kept inside the capillaries which have the\ndimensions less than a hair thickness, it will remain fluid even at a very low\ntemperature below zero.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In areas of the earth where water freezes at night and\nthaws again in the morning, we find the toughest rocks splitting and being\nbroken down. Ice melts when slight pressure is applied, but under high\npressure, liquid freezes. If you open a bottle of pressurized soda water, it\nwill freeze instantly. Water is the only substance that has its highest density\nas a liquid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water also has a high\nheat of vaporization, so a lot of energy from the Sun is needed to turn liquid\nwater into vapor. It takes four times as much energy to heat a given mass of\nwater by 1\u00b0C as it does to heat the same mass of dry air. Perspiration is the\nmost effective way to cool the human body. Water bodies in the tropics don't\nget evaporated so quickly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As temperature\nincreases, a substance\u2019s density generally decreases. But pure water is an\nexception to this rule\u2014it is the only known substance that has its highest\ndensity as a liquid. It is the only natural substance found in all three states\n-- solid, liquid and gas -- within the range of natural Earth temperatures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has very high\nsurface tension (helping it move through roots and capillaries -- vital to\nmaintaining life on Earth) and is virtually incompressible. Because of the\ninternal tension of water it can drag itself upwards through tall trees without\nbreaking off in its upwards flow.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This upwards flow is caused by the water\nflowing out of the leaves into the air, pulling more water up as it does so .\nThe high surface tension of water - its tendency to fight being pulled apart -\nexplains why it forms droplets and why it climbs up the sides of a straw.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A well-known anomaly of\nwater is that its density is highest at four degrees Celsius above the freezing\npoint. Thus, ice floats on water, whereas the solid state of other compounds\nwould sink in their liquids.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This permits life to survive safely under the ice\nduring freezing weather. Ice would sink to the bottom of the sea otherwise ,\naway from the melting warmth of the sunshine. Unlike other liquids, water\nexpands in freezing.Completely pure water is a poor conductor of electricity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water is the universal\nmedium for all biological activity; it dissolves, dilutes, transports, and\nreacts with every chemical essential for life. Cell-associated water (vicinal\nwater) has different properties than ordinary water. It is less dense, requires\nmore energy to heat, has greater viscosity, and different phase change\ntemperatures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most mysterious and\ncontroversial property of water, however, is its ability to hold and store\nmemory. It easily penetrates the 75 trillion cells and mitochondrial\nmembranes, to supply nutrients and flush away toxins.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As we grow old our\nbodies are NOT able to absorb water into the cells, unless its surface tension\nis lowered ( even by mantras ) . We are more than 70% of water. &nbsp;Theertham water has low surface tension ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Q3oItpVa9fs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Q3oItpVa9fs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normal healthy living\ncells emit frequencies of sound in the alpha range, between 8 and 14\nhertz.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therapeutic infrasound produces\nalpha sound waves in the approximate range of 8 to 14Hz in a multiple, random,\nchaotic signal.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sound waves travel\nand penetrate deeply throughout the body.&nbsp;\nInfrasound can be applied over a plaster cast, boots or wraps. Unlike a\nsingle frequency, the chaotic nature of the infrasound overrides the body's\nnatural ability to tune out a rhythmic, predictable pattern.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dmitri Ivanovich\nMendeleev , the great Russian chemist and inventor formulated the Periodic Law,\nand the periodic table of elements.&nbsp; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was denied a Nobel\nprize for telling that his table is based on the divine Sanskrit alphabets.\nMendeleev, studied Sanskrit at a university in St Petersburg, used Sanskrit\nprefixes eka, dvi, and tri to name those yet-to-be-discovered elements.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mendeleev had expressed\nhis appreciation and debt to the great Sanskrit grammarian Panini of ancient\nIndia, who had created sophisticated theories of language based on their\ndiscovery of the two-dimensional patterns in basic sounds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt;\">\"I saw in a dream a table where all elements fell into place as required. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like the musical scale\nof Sanskrit, the elements in the periodic table are also arranged, very\nlogically, in rows and columns based on how each letter is pronounced.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mendeleev gleaned that\nPanini did the phonological patterning of Sanskrit alphabet sounds as a\nfunction of their articulatory properties.&nbsp;\nSo he just&nbsp; arranged the chemical\nproperties of elements are a function of their atomic weights.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is impossible\nunless Sanskrit is a divine language.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why Sanskrit\nmantras can reprogram human DNA.&nbsp; You may\nscoff, but even homosexuality can be cured.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mendeleev noted how\nPanini broke the phonetic parallelism of sounds when the simplicity of the\nsystem required it, e.g. putting the velar to the right of the labial in the\nnasal row. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So he gave priority to\nisomorphism over atomic weights when they conflicted, e.g. putting beryllium in\nthe magnesium family because it patterns with it even though, by atomic weight,\nit seemed to belong with nitrogen and phosphorus.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In both cases, the\nperiodicities they discovered would later be explained by a theory of the\ninternal structure of the elements. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Siva produced 14\nsound sequences from the Damaru while in the throes of his tandav. These sounds\nformed the foundations for later developments of all phenomes of speech, notes\nof music and beats of dance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you speak the bija\nmantras, you resonate with the energy of the associated chakra.--as mentioned\nin the&nbsp; Jabala Darsana Upanishad in 5000\nBC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ham, Yam, Ram, Vam and\nLam are the panch bhoota mantras.&nbsp; The\nfive elements evolve from the five tanamatras (principals); earth from gandha\n(smell), water from rasa (taste), fire from rupa (sight), air from sparsha\n(touch) and akasha from shabda (hearing). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; The\nconnection with the element is created by the tongue position in the mouth and\nby visualising the shape of the element when sounding the mantra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-n1USa2IYotI/VjCTSPxqRHI/AAAAAAABBPA/WTvucZJ2SxA/s1600/Page%2B10%2BCu6SF5ehakra.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-n1USa2IYotI/VjCTSPxqRHI/AAAAAAABBPA/WTvucZJ2SxA/s1600/Page%2B10%2BCu6SF5ehakra.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cLAM\u201d-&nbsp; Muladhara chakra 1 (root)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When properly produced,\nthe sound LANG excites the nadis (subtle channels of energy) in the first\nchakra and creates a lock that prevents the downward movement of energy. LA is\nthe sound for the earth element and NG is nada-bindu, the primal cosmic sound\nfrom which the universe manifested. Repetition of the bija manta LANG deepens\nconcentration, giving awareness and inner strength. Its vibrations create a\npassage inside the Brahma Nadi. Brahma Nadi, is the subtle channel through\nwhich the Kundalini, when awakened moves from Muladhara to Sahasrara Chakra.\nThe element associated with the Muladhara Chakra is Earth. The square is the\nsymbol for Earth. It represents the four directions and the four dimensions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cVAM\u201d-&nbsp; Swadisthana chakra 2 (sacral/navel)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the bija mantra\nVANG is repeated the Svadhishtana Chakra is purified. The power of Varuna, an\naspect of Vishnu (the sustainer of creation) is present in thebija mantra VANG.\nIn Hindu mythology, Varuna is considered the god of all forms of the water\nelement. When the bija mantra VANG is repeated it enhances the production and\ncirculation of fluids in the body. The shape associated with this element is\nthe circle, which represents the element water. Water droplets are spherical.\nWater is the essence of life. Almost three quarters of the human body is water,\nwhich is present in blood, mucous, urine, saliva, lymph and other fluids.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cRAM\u201d- Manipura chakra\n3 (solar plexus)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bija mantra for\nthis chakra is RAM sounded as RANG.&nbsp; Agni\nis the god of fire and the acceptor of sacrifices. The ram is the vehicle of\nAgni. The ram is the carrier of the bija mantra RAM. The sound RANG increases\nthe digestive fire, which enhances assimilation and absorption. It contributes\nto longevity, the main goal of a person motivated by this chakra. The nature of\nfire is to move upwards and the repetition of this mantra, when produced\nproperly helps the upward movement of the Kundalini. The fire element in the\nnavel region aids in the digestion and absorption of food,which supplies the\nwhole body with vital energy. The fire element is related tohunger, thirst,\nsleep, lethargy and radiance (ojas). The triangle is the symbol of the fire\nelement. Visualisation of a triangle of bright redcolour in the Manipura Chakra\nhelps the aspirant in his/her spiritual evolution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cYAM\u201d- Anahata chakra 4\n(heart)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bija mantra for\nthis chakra is YAM sounded as YANG. The mantra is focused in the heart chakra.\nWhen this sound is produced properly the spiritual heart vibrates and any\nblocks in the cardiac region are cleared. True knowledge dawns in the\nconsciousness and the second knot, the Vishnu Granthi, is undone, allowing\nenergy to start to flow upward. Sounding the bija mantra YANG gives one control\nover air, prana and the breath. The bija mantra YANG is the sound form of the\ndeity Vayu, the lord of the air/wind. The Anahata Chakra is associated with the\nsix-pointed star which is made up of two triangles. The one pointing upwards\nsymbolises Shiva, the male principal. The other triangle points downward\nsymbolising Shakti, the female principal--stolen by the Jews. &nbsp;The six-pointed star also symbolises the\nbalancing of energy in the Heart chakra, which lies between the three chakras\nabove it and the three chakras below it. The Anahata Chakra is associated with\nlove and the desire for sharing and sympathy. Here energy can move upward or\ndownward. The element associated with the Anahata Chakra is vayu (air or wind).\nVayu is thevital life-giving force (prana). It aids the functions of the lungs\nand heart, circulating fresh oxygen and vital energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cHAM\u201d- Vishudha chakra\n5 (throat)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bija mantra for\nthis chakra is HAM sounded as HANG. The \u2018H\u2019 sound in the bija mantra HANG is\nproduced at the back of the throat. The mantra is focused in the throat chakra.\nWhen this sound is produced properly. It vibrates the brain and causes the\ncerebrospinal fluid to flow more freely in the throat region.&nbsp; The Vishuddha Chakra is associated with the\nelement akasha (ether) and the sense of hearing, as well as the action of\nspeaking. The symbol for this chakra is the crescent. The sliver crescent is\nthe symbol of nada, pure cosmic sound. The moon implies psychic energy,\nclairvoyance andcommunication without words. The influence of the five elements\nceases after the fifth chakra and the aspirant becomes a tattvatit, one who has\ngone beyond the grip of the elements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cOM\u201d- Ajna chakra 6\n(third eye/brow)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bija mantra AUM .\nThe pravana, AUM, is the source of all sounds and is connected with anahata\nnada, the primal cosmic sound. It thus creates unity and is a combination of\nsun (A), moon (U), and fire (M). The third eye plays an important role in the\npiercing of the third knot, Rudra Granthi. When Rudra Granthi is pierced,\nindividuality is dropped, the old ego awareness is left behind and the\nexperience of unmanifest consciousness emerges at the Sahasrara Chakra. The\nsymbol for this chakra is the circle with two petals on either side. A person\nwho has reached this level of awareness has a body that constantly radiates the\nsound AUM. The aura of such persons enables all those who come into their\npresence to become calm and sensitive to the refined sound frequencies of AUM.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cALL AH\u201d-&nbsp; Sahasrara chakra 7 (crown)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Sanskrit the word\n\u2018Sahasrara\u2019, means thousand, so the Sahasrara Chakra is the \u2018Lotus of the\nThousand Petals\u2019 and is located four finger-breadths above the crown of the\nhead. When the Kundalini is raised up to the Sahasrara Chakra, the illusion of\nthe \u2018individual self\u2019 is dissolved. According to the scriptures, the Sahasrara\nChakra is the seat of the self-luminous Self, the essence of being. The sounds\nassociated with this chakra are ALL and AH .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-23EzI61kB04/VjCTmaIcLZI/AAAAAAABBPI/ml8-Trfzlgs/s1600/bija-mantFGras.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-23EzI61kB04/VjCTmaIcLZI/AAAAAAABBPI/ml8-Trfzlgs/s400/bija-mantFGras.jpg\" width=\"297\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Houm (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0939\u094c\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the beej mantra\nof Lord Shiva to dispel sorrow.&nbsp;&nbsp; Ha is\nSiva and au is Sadasiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kreem (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u094d\u0930\u0940\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the beej mantra\nof Goddess Kali to overcome unhappiness and to arouse kundalini ( supreme life\nforce ) .&nbsp;&nbsp; Ka is Kali, ra is Brahman,\nand ee is Mahamaya. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hreem ( Description:\nhttp://www.rudraksha-ratna.com/images/mantra_images/BM4.gif)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the beej mantra\nof Maha maya ( consciousness ) . Ha means Siva, ra is prakriti, ee means\nMahamaya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the beej mantra\nof Goddess Lakshmi for prosperity and fertility.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sha is Lakshmi, ra means wealth, ee is\ncontentment. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aim (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0910\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the beej&nbsp; Mantra of Goddess Matangi ( the tantric form\nof Goddess Saraswati ) for learning and mastery of arts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Klim (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u094d\u0932\u0940\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the beej mantra\nfor Lord Krishna to acquire happiness..&nbsp;\nLa means lord of the senses. Ee means&nbsp;\nsatisfaction.&nbsp; bring happiness and\nsorrow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hoom Description:\nhttp://www.rudraksha-ratna.com/images/mantra_images/BM8.gif<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a beej matra\nofShiva.&nbsp;&nbsp; Ha is Siva, and u is\nBhairava.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Gam (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the beej mantra\nfor Lord Ganeshaa to overcome unhappiness..&nbsp;\nGa means Ganesha, and bindu is the dispeller of sorrow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glaum-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a beej matra of\nGanesha.&nbsp; Ga means Ganesha, la means that\nwhich pervades, au means luster or brilliance, and bindu is the dispeller of\nsorrow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kshroum (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u094d\u0937\u094d\u0930\u094c\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the beej mantra\nof Lord Narasimha for overcoming grief.&nbsp;\nKsha is Narasimha, ra is Brahma, au means with teeth pointing upwards,\nand bindu means dispeller of sorrow. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HLREEM-&nbsp;&nbsp; This is the beej mantra of Goddess Bagalamukhi&nbsp; (Pitambara / Brahmastra rupini ) . The\naddition of the la-sound to the mantra Hreem gives it the power to stop\nthings.&nbsp; This mantra is to stop all\ninternal foes--in the form of fears, doubts, worries, ego, etc.&nbsp;&nbsp; And to paralyze external foes: those who\nwish to do you harm to you in some way, especially in the form of speech and\nwritten word. Bagalamukhi is the secret presence of the opposite wherein each\nthing is dissolved back into the Unborn and the Uncreated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Words like namaaha,\nsvaaha, svadha, vashat, voushat, hum and phat are joined to the bijas. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These words either\ndepict the mental state of a seeker at the time of chanting the mantra or\nwhatever he wishes to achieve... Their implied meanings are as follows.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A. Namaaha&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : The serene state of the antahkaran&nbsp;&nbsp; appeasing the deity of the mantra by\nsurrendering to it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">B. Svaaha&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : Destruction of harmful energy,\nappeasing the deity of the mantra with offerings.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C. Svadha&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : Self-contentment, strengthening\noneself<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">D. Vashat&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : A spiritual emotion of destroying the\nenemy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">E. Voushat&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : To create conflicts or opposition among\nenemies,&nbsp; to acquire power and wealth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">F. Hum&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : Anger and courage, to frighten\none\u2019s enemy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">G. Phat&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : A spiritual emotion of attacking\nthe enemy, to drive the enemy away.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In between the white\ninvader injected poison into our beej mantras using&nbsp; Raja Ram Mohan Roy \u2013&nbsp; wanna see an example?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Brahman : rhim<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Kshatriya : shrim<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Vaishya : klim<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Shudra : aim<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They made beej mantra\nfor the FAKE and non-existent RADHA too. &nbsp;&nbsp;Like how they made Gotras for the Chitpavan\nJews nay Brahmins.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TEEE HEEEEE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting back-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two or more beejas are\nsometimes combined. This results in greater diversity, in the energy of the\nmantra .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Example: rheem shreem,\nkreem&nbsp; is a conjoined bijamantra.&nbsp; All the three bijas are various forms of the\nsame energy - rheem = the Great Illusion (Maya),&nbsp; shreem = Lakshmi and kreem = Kali.&nbsp;&nbsp; Thus these 3 beejas represent creation,\nsustenance and destruction respectively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Energy of beej mantra\nfrequency activates requisite chakras and channelizes nadis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Mantras concluding with words like \u2018hum, phat\u2019\nare masculine mantras. Such mantras help in vanquishing enemies or in changing\nthe minds of others. Mantras of the Sun deity are masculine mantras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantras concluding with\nwords like tham, svaha or svadha are feminine mantras.&nbsp; Many such mantras are useful in curing\nillnesses.&nbsp; Mantras of the moon are\nfeminine mantras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantras ending with\n\u2018namaha\u2019 are considered as neutral mantras. Such mantras are used to fulfill\nsome desire.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The modern world has\nwoken up to the potential of using&nbsp; the\npower of longitudinal wave sound vibration . Our ancient maharishis&nbsp; used sound in its gross and subtle states to\npenetrate the planes of human consciousness and to reach brahmAn.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As I said, beej mantras\nare seed mantra.&nbsp; Each deity has a\nspecific beej mantra.&nbsp; At the first\ninstance it stops the chatter of mind. Conscious repetition will morph into\nunconscious repetition.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Beej mantras for Ganesh, Vishnu, Hanuman,\nLakshmi and Saraswathi can be practiced by any one.
